article:
flows from a wound in the trunk of a [[Corymbia calophylla]] (Marri)]] 'Gum' is
 a sap or other resinous material associated with certain species of the plant
 kingdom. This material is often polysaccharide-based and most frequently is
 associated with woody plants, particularly under the bark or as a seed coating.
 The polysaccharide material is typically of high molecular weight and most
 often highly hydrophilic or hydrocolloidal.
